name: Flow Alteration (Regulation / Water Use)
functionStatement: Integrates the range of "typical" flows experienced by other processes. Examines the degree to which upstream infrastructure or land uses have fundamentally altered flow regimes (e.g., hydropeaking, dams, withdrawals).
descriptionMarkdown: "Degree of alteration in flow magnitude, timing, duration, or permanence relative to natural conditions due to regulation, withdrawals/returns, or watershed change. Compares current daily-flow pattern to the natural regime, combining IHA metrics with the Richards-Baker flashiness index to screen for alteration from dams, withdrawals, or urbanization."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel

Method: Desktop (gage/records) with field verification where feasible; Desktop
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Use available flow records (gage data), modeled natural baseline estimates, and/or water-use/rights information to estimate change from expected natural conditions for the metric definition. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Compare current mean annual flow to a natural or historical baseline and report percent difference."

inputs.label: Flow Alteration (Regulation / Water Use)
inputs.type: desktop (gage/records) with field verification where feasible; desktop
inputs.helpMarkdown: "ADNR, ADF&G flow regulation & water rights data USGS NWIS (gage data where available); modeled baseline hydrology; water-use/rights datasets; dam regulation information. "

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: <10% difference from baseline. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: >50% difference. Near dewatering or strong hydropeaking. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
